com.ikalagaming.core.packages

Interface Package

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IPlugin
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Console, EventManager, InputPackage, LoggingPackage, PackageManager, Plugin, RngPackageMain

    public interface Package
    A distinct chunk of the program with a specific purpose and methods for managing its state and interacting with the main program.
    Author:
    Ches Burks

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double version
      Which version of the package this is.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean disable()
      Deactivates the package and halts all of its operations.
      boolean enable()
      Activates the package and enables it to perform its normal functions.
      java.util.Set<Listener> getListeners()
      Returns a list of listeners for this package.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the type of package this is.
      PackageManager getPackageManager()
      Returns the current package manager reference, if it exists.
      double getVersion()
      Returns this classes version number.
      boolean isEnabled()
      Returns true if the package is enabled, and false otherwise.
      void onDisable()
      This method is called when the package is disabled.
      void onEnable()
      This method is called when the package is enabled.
      void onLoad()
      Called when the package is loaded into memory.
      void onUnload()
      Called when the package is unloaded from memory.
      boolean reload()
      Disables and then enables the package.
      void setPackageManager(PackageManager parent)
      Stores a reference to the PackageManager that is handling this package.

    • Field Detail

      • version

        static final double version
        Which version of the package this is. This changes periodically for each package subclass as they are changed and updated.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • disable

        boolean disable()
        Deactivates the package and halts all of its operations. The package is still loaded in memory but not active. Calls onDisable().
        Returns:
        true if the package has been successfully disabled

      • enable

        boolean enable()
        Activates the package and enables it to perform its normal functions. Calls onEnable().
        Returns:
        true if the package was successfully enabled

      • getPackageManager

        PackageManager getPackageManager()
        Returns the current package manager reference, if it exists.
        Returns:
        the parent package manager

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the type of package this is. This is a string that describes the package, such as "Graphics" or "AI".
        Returns:
        a string descriptor of the package

      • getVersion

        double getVersion()
        Returns this classes version number. This changes periodically for each package subclass as they are changed and updated.
        Returns:
        the version

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled()
        Returns true if the package is enabled, and false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if the package is enabled

      • onDisable

        void onDisable()
        This method is called when the package is disabled.

      • onEnable

        void onEnable()
        This method is called when the package is enabled. Initialization tends to be performed here.

      • onLoad

        void onLoad()
        Called when the package is loaded into memory. The package may or may not be enabled at this time.

      • onUnload

        void onUnload()
        Called when the package is unloaded from memory.

      • reload

        boolean reload()
        Disables and then enables the package.
        Returns:
        true if the package restarted successfully

      • setPackageManager

        void setPackageManager(PackageManager parent)
        Stores a reference to the PackageManager that is handling this package.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent package manager

      • getListeners

        java.util.Set<Listener> getListeners()
        Returns a list of listeners for this package. These listeners will be used with the event system.
        Returns:
        a list of listeners for the package.
